isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM WITH TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - 9200, 9300 and 9400 - OPERATION - ABS WARNING LIGHT

svcprocinfo.para: The ABS controller uses the warning light relay to control the ABS warning light.

svcsubproc.title: Warning Light
svcsubproc.para:
The antilock warning light is located in the right gauge cluster. When the vehicle is started, the "Initial Start-up Self Diagnostic Test" will be run. The test is fully explained in TROUBLESHOOTING
. The yellow warning light also will illuminate if during this test or normal operation, the controller senses a system defect.

The ABS warning light receives ignition power (key ON) through connector (420), on circuit 28C/13V from 10A fuse F4-A. The ground side of the ABS light is connected from connector (420), through circuit 94E to common terminal 30 of the warning light relay (165). ABS warning light relay (165) normally closed terminal (87A) is connected by circuit 94-G to ground adapter (455). With this relay de-energized, the ground path for the ABS warning light is completed and the light is ON.

svcsubproc.title: Warning Light Relay (165)
svcsubproc.para: Warning light relay control coil (terminal 85) receives ignition power (key ON) on circuit 13W/94B from ignition adapter (494). The ground side of the control coil, terminal 86, is connected through circuit 94H/Grey wire to controller connector (355) terminal E3. The controller opens (light ON) or closes (light OFF) a ground switch for terminal E3, in response to programmed instructions.

During the Self Diagnostic Test when starting the vehicle or if a failure occurs in the antilock system, the controller opens the ground path for the warning light relay coil causing it to de-energize, resulting in the illumination of the yellow instrument panel warning light.

note.para: If the antilock system is operating properly during normal vehicle operation, the lamp will not be illuminated.
